message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY

This paper deals with the problem of estimating the covariance of roto-translations computed by the Iterative Closest Point (ICP) algorithm, which is relevant for localization of mobile robots and vehicles equipped with depth-sensing cameras or Lidar. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.RO (Robotics). The paper also involves computer vision techniques for depth-sensing cameras, which makes cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) another likely category. The paper proposes a mathematical proof, which involves linear least-squares problems, and hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also possible categories. Finally, the paper deals with the problem of localization, which is a control problem, and hence, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is another possible category.
